sen.j: 長良川鵜飼（ながらがわうかい）とは、岐阜県岐阜市の長良川で毎年5月11日から10月15日まで行われる鵜飼いである。
sen.e: Nagara-gawa ukai is ukai (cormorant fishing) that is conducted in Nagara-gawa river in Gifu City, Gifu Prefecture during the period from May 11 to October 15 every year.
Nagara-gawa ukai is ukai (cormorant fishing) that is conducted in Nagara-gawa River in Gifu City, Gifu Prefecture during the period from May 11 to October 15 every year.
Nagara-gawa ukai is ukai (cormorant fishing) that is conducted in Nagara-gawa River in Gifu City, Gifu Prefecture during the period from May 11 to October 15 every year.

sen.j: 中秋の名月と増水時を除く毎夜行われる。
sen.e: It is conducted every night except for the day of harvest moon and when the river rises.
It is conducted every night except for the day of harvest moon and when the river rises.
It is conducted every night except for the day of harvest moon and when the river rises.

sen.j: 中秋の名月に行われないのは、満月の月明かりにより篝火に鮎が集まりにくいため。
sen.e: The reason why it is not conducted on the day of harvest moon is that sweetfishes are not lured by kagaribi (fishing fire) due to the light of full moon.
The reason why it is not conducted on the day of harvest moon is that sweetfishes are not lured by kagaribi (fishing fire) due to the light of full moon.
The reason why it is not conducted on the day of harvest moon is that sweetfishes are not lured by kagaribi (fishing fire) due to the light of full moon.

sen.j: 1300年ほど前から行われており起源は漁としての鵜飼だった。
sen.e: It has been conducted for about 1,300 years, and its origin was ukai for fishery.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: It has been conducted for about 1,300 years, and its origin was ukai for fishery.
It has been conducted for about 1,300 years, and its origin was ukai for fishery.

sen.j: しかし、現在は古典漁法を今に伝える観光としての鵜飼である。
sen.e: Currently, however, ukai is conducted as a tourist attraction inheriting traditional fishing method.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Currently, however, ukai is conducted as a tourist attraction inheriting traditional fishing method.
Currently, however, ukai is conducted as a tourist attraction inheriting traditional fishing method.

sen.j: そのうち宮内庁の御料場で行われる8回の鵜飼は「御料鵜飼」と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Ukai that is conducted eight times a year at Imperial Household Agency's goryoba (fishing ground for the Imperial Court) is called "goryo ukai".
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Ukai that is conducted eight times a year at Imperial Household Agency's goryoba (fishing ground for the Imperial Court) is called 'goryo ukai.'
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しましたピリオド位置を訂正しました。
sen.e: Ukai that is conducted eight times a year at Imperial Household Agency's goryoba (fishing ground for the Imperial Court) is called 'goryo ukai.'

sen.j: 獲れたアユは皇居へ献上されるのみならず、明治神宮や伊勢神宮へも奉納される。
sen.e: Sweetfishes that are caught in goryo ukai are offered not only to the Imperial Palace but also to Meiji-jingu Shrine and Ise-jingu Shrine.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Sweetfishes that are caught in goryo ukai are offered not only to the Imperial Palace but also to Meiji-jingu Shrine and Ise-jingu Shrine.
Sweetfishes that are caught in goryo ukai are offered not only to the Imperial Palace but also to Meiji-jingu Shrine and Ise-jingu Shrine.

sen.j: 長良川における鵜飼は日本で唯一皇室御用の鵜飼であり、長良川の鵜匠は職名を宮内庁式部職鵜匠という。
sen.e: Ukai of Nagara-gawa river is the sole ukai in Japan that is patronized by the Imperial Court, and the official job title of ujo (a fisherman of cormorant fishing) of Nagara-gawa ukai is shikibushoku ujo of Kunaicho (Imperial Household Agency).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Ukai of Nagara-gawa River is the sole ukai in Japan that is patronized by the Imperial Court, and the official job title of usho (a fisherman of cormorant fishing) of Nagara-gawa ukai is shikibushoku usho of Kunaicho (Imperial Household Agency).
sen.cmt: River大文字にしました。鵜匠→Ushoに訂正しました。
sen.e: Ukai of Nagara-gawa River is the sole ukai in Japan that is patronized by the Imperial Court, and the official job title of usho (a fisherman of cormorant fishing) of Nagara-gawa ukai is shikibushoku usho of Kunaicho (Imperial Household Agency).

sen.j: 長良川の鵜飼用具一式122点は国の重要有形民俗文化財、長良川鵜飼漁法は岐阜市指定無形民俗文化財である。
sen.e: A set of tools for Nagara-gawa uaki, a total of 122 pieces, are designated as national important tangible assets of folk culture, and the fishing method of Nagara-gawa ukai is designated as intangible folk cultural asset by Gifu City.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: A set of tools for Nagara-gawa uaki, a total of 122 pieces, are designated as national important tangible assets of folk culture, and the fishing method of Nagara-gawa ukai is designated as intangible folk cultural asset by Gifu City.

A set of tools for Nagara-gawa uaki, a total of 122 pieces, are designated as national important tangible assets of folk culture, and the fishing method of Nagara-gawa ukai is designated as intangible folk cultural asset by Gifu City.

sen.j: また、この鵜飼が行われる長良川中流域は1985年「名水百選」に選定された。
sen.e: The middle reaches of Nagara-gawa river where ukai is conducted was selected in 1985 as one of "the best 100 natural water sources in Japan".
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: The middle reaches of Nagara-gawa River where ukai is conducted was selected in 1985 as one of 'the best 100 natural water sources in Japan.'
sen.cmt: River大文字にしました。原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しましたピリオド位置を訂正しました。
sen.e: The middle reaches of Nagara-gawa River where ukai is conducted was selected in 1985 as one of 'the best 100 natural water sources in Japan.'

sen.j: また岐阜市の長良橋から上流約1kmまでの水浴場が1998年環境省認定「日本の水浴場55選」に、2001年「日本の水浴場88選」に全国で唯一河川の水浴場で選定された。
sen.e: Also, a bathing place located along the river, about one kilometer from the Nagara bridge in Gifu City toward the upper stream, was selected by the Ministry of Environment as one of " the best 55 bathing places in Japan" in 1998 as well as one of "the best 88 bathing places in Japan" in 2001, the sole case among riverside bathing places.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Also, a bathing place located along the river, about one kilometer from the Nagara Bridge in Gifu City toward the upper stream, was selected by the Ministry of Environment as one of 'the best 55 bathing places in Japan' in 1998 as well as one of 'the best 88 bathing places in Japan' in 2001, the sole case among riverside bathing places.
sen.cmt: Bridge大文字にしました。不要なスペースを削除しました。原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました
sen.e: Also, a bathing place located along the river, about one kilometer from the Nagara Bridge in Gifu City toward the upper stream, was selected by the Ministry of Environment as one of 'the best 55 bathing places in Japan' in 1998 as well as one of 'the best 88 bathing places in Japan' in 2001, the sole case among riverside bathing places.

sen.j: 舟首に篝火を付けた鵜舟に鵜匠が乗り10～12羽の鵜を手縄をさばき、操り、篝火に集まってきた鮎を鵜が次々に捕る。
sen.e: Ujo gets on ubune (a boat used for ukai) with kagaribi at its bow and controls 10 to 12 cormorants by handling tenawa (a hand rope), and cormorants catch sweetfishes that gather under kagaribi.
Usho gets on ubune (a boat used for ukai) with kagaribi at its bow and controls 10 to 12 cormorants by handling tenawa (a hand rope), and cormorants catch sweetfishes that gather under kagaribi.
Usho gets on ubune (a boat used for ukai) with kagaribi at its bow and controls 10 to 12 cormorants by handling tenawa (a hand rope), and cormorants catch sweetfishes that gather under kagaribi.

sen.j: 鵜匠は常日頃から鵜と一緒に生活しているため、鵜匠と鵜は呼吸の合った動きを見せ、見事に鮎を捕らえてくる。
sen.e: As ujo always lives together with cormorants, ujo and cormorants get along perfectly and cormorants catch sweetfishes neatly.
As usho always lives together with cormorants, usho and cormorants get along perfectly and cormorants catch sweetfishes neatly.
As usho always lives together with cormorants, usho and cormorants get along perfectly and cormorants catch sweetfishes neatly.

sen.j: 鵜の捕った鮎は鵜匠のより吐き篭に吐かせられる。
sen.e: Ujo gets cormorants to spit out sweetfishes into a basket.
Usho gets cormorants to spit out sweetfishes into a basket.
Usho gets cormorants to spit out sweetfishes into a basket.

sen.j: 総がらみによる巻き狩り漁法は幻想的である。
sen.e: A fishing method called Makigari, which is conducted by six ships, is fantastic.
A fishing method called Makigari, which is conducted by six ships, is fantastic.
A fishing method called Makigari, which is conducted by six ships, is fantastic.

sen.j: 漁に出る前にその日の出漁の順番を供乗りのクジ引きにより決める。
sen.e: The order of going out fishing is decided by a drawing done by tomonori (a person responsible for steering a ship).
The order of going out fishing is decided by a drawing done by tomonori (a person responsible for steering a ship).
The order of going out fishing is decided by a drawing done by tomonori (a person responsible for steering a ship).

sen.j: 順番により漁獲量が変わるため鵜匠にとっては重要である。
sen.e: As a haul of fish varies depending on the order, this drawing is important for ujo.
As a haul of fish varies depending on the order, this drawing is important for usho.
As a haul of fish varies depending on the order, this drawing is important for usho.

sen.j: 風折烏帽子（かざおりえぼし）
sen.e: Kazaorieboshi
Kazaorieboshi
Kazaorieboshi

sen.j: 黒または紺色の麻布で、頭に巻き付けて篝火から髪の毛を守る。
sen.e: It is black or dark-blue hemp, and it is put around a head for the purpose of protecting hair from kagaribi.
It is black or dark-blue hemp, and it is put around a head for the purpose of protecting hair from kagaribi.
It is black or dark-blue hemp, and it is put around a head for the purpose of protecting hair from kagaribi.

sen.j: 先が尖っているのは本来ちょん髷を収納するためのもの。
sen.e: The reason why its tip is angular is because it was originally designed to cover topknot.
The reason why its tip is angular is because it was originally designed to cover topknot.
The reason why its tip is angular is because it was originally designed to cover topknot.

sen.j: 形が風に吹かれ折れてるように見える事からこの名前が付いた。
sen.e: This name derived from the fact that its shape looks like the one that was broken by the wind.
This name derived from the fact that its shape looks like the one that was broken by the wind.
This name derived from the fact that its shape looks like the one that was broken by the wind.

sen.j: 漁服（りょうふく）
sen.e: Ryofuku (clothes for fishing)
Ryofuku (clothes for fishing)
Ryofuku (clothes for fishing)

sen.j: 黒または紺色の木綿で出来た服。
sen.e: Clothes made of black or dark-blue cotton.
Clothes made of black or dark-blue cotton.
Clothes made of black or dark-blue cotton.

sen.j: 明るい色の服は鵜の恐怖心を煽るため暗い色の服になった。
sen.e: Dark colors are used for ryofuku because bright colors stir cormorants' fear.
Dark colors are used for ryofuku because bright colors stir cormorants' fear.
Dark colors are used for ryofuku because bright colors stir cormorants' fear.

sen.j: 胸あて（むねあて）
sen.e: Muneate (bib)
Muneate (bib)
Muneate (bib)

sen.j: 火の粉や松脂を避けるためのもの。
sen.e: It is used for protecting the body from sparks and pine resin.
It is used for protecting the body from sparks and pine resin.
It is used for protecting the body from sparks and pine resin.

sen.j: 収納ポケットにもなる。
sen.e: It is also used as a pocket.
It is also used as a pocket.
It is also used as a pocket.

sen.j: 腰蓑（こしみの）
sen.e: Koshimino (grass skirt)
Koshimino (grass skirt)
Koshimino (grass skirt)

sen.j: ワラ製で水しぶきを払い体が冷えるのを防ぐ。
sen.e: It is made of straws and is used to keep the body warm by brushing off splashes.
It is made of straws and is used to keep the body warm by brushing off splashes.
It is made of straws and is used to keep the body warm by brushing off splashes.

sen.j: 足半（あしなか）
sen.e: Ashinaka (footwear)
Ashinaka (footwear)
Ashinaka (footwear)

sen.j: ワラ製で普通のわらじの半分の長さのつま先で履くわらじ。
sen.e: Ashinaka is waraji (straw sandal) whose size is half the normal one and is put on by a toe.
Ashinaka is waraji (straw sandal) whose size is half the normal one and is put on by a toe.
Ashinaka is waraji (straw sandal) whose size is half the normal one and is put on by a toe.

sen.j: 魚の脂や水垢で滑らないようになっている。
sen.e: It is devised to prevent slipping caused by fat of fish or fur.
It is devised to prevent slipping caused by fat of fish or fur.
It is devised to prevent slipping caused by fat of fish or fur.

sen.j: ワラで作った足半は貴重なため、ビニール紐で作った足半が使用される場合が多い。
sen.e: As straw-made ashinaka is expensive, vinyl-made ahinaka is often used.
As straw-made ashinaka is expensive, vinyl-made ahinaka is often used.
As straw-made ashinaka is expensive, vinyl-made ahinaka is often used.

sen.j: 鵜舟（うぶね）
sen.e: Ubune
Ubune
Ubune

sen.j: 鵜匠が鵜飼に用いる舟を鵜舟という。
sen.e: A boat which ujo uses for ukai is called ubune.
A boat which usho uses for ukai is called ubune.
A boat which usho uses for ukai is called ubune.

sen.j: 全長約13m。
sen.e: Its length is about 13m.
Its length is about 13m.
Its length is about 13m.

sen.j: 鵜舟には鵜匠のほか鵜舟を操る責任者「供乗り（とものり）」と、鵜匠と供乗りの助手である「中乗り（なかのり）」が乗っている。
sen.e: Other than ujo, "tomonori", who is responsible for steering a ship, and "nakanori", an assistant for ujo and tomonori, are on board ubune.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Other than usho, 'tomonori,' who is responsible for steering a ship, and 'nakanori,' an assistant for usho and tomonori, are on board ubune.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。鵜匠→Ushoに訂正しました。
sen.e: Other than usho, 'tomonori,' who is responsible for steering a ship, and 'nakanori,' an assistant for usho and tomonori, are on board ubune.

sen.j: この3人が1組となって鮎を捕りながら長良川を下っていく。
sen.e: These three persons make a team and go down Nagara-gawa river while catching ayu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: These three persons make a team and go down Nagara-gawa River while catching ayu.
These three persons make a team and go down Nagara-gawa River while catching ayu.

sen.j: 岐阜市営の鵜飼観覧船造船所にて造船された鵜舟が使用されている。
sen.e: Ubune built at Ukai Kanransen Zosenjo (shipyard of spectators boat of cormorant fishing) operated by Gifu City is being used.
Ubune built at Ukai Kanransen Zosenjo (shipyard of spectators boat of cormorant fishing) operated by Gifu City is being used.
Ubune built at Ukai Kanransen Zosenjo (shipyard of spectators boat of cormorant fishing) operated by Gifu City is being used.

sen.j: 鵜
sen.e: Cormorants
Cormorants
Cormorants

sen.j: 鵜飼に使用する鵜はウミウを使っている。
sen.e: Temminck's cormorants are used for ukai.
Temminck's cormorants are used for ukai.
Temminck's cormorants are used for ukai.

sen.j: これはカワウに比べ海鵜の方が体が大きく丈夫なためである。
sen.e: This is because temminck's cormorants are bigger and stronger than common cormorants.
This is because temminck's cormorants are bigger and stronger than common cormorants.
This is because temminck's cormorants are bigger and stronger than common cormorants.

sen.j: 野生の海鵜を捕獲してきて2～3年訓練した後、鵜飼で使用される。
sen.e: Temminck's cormorants are used for ukai after having been trained for two to three years.
Temminck's cormorants are used for ukai after having been trained for two to three years.
Temminck's cormorants are used for ukai after having been trained for two to three years.

sen.j: 鵜匠は自宅に20羽前後の鵜を飼っていて、漁に出る数時間前に全ての鵜を捕まえ鵜篭に入れる。
sen.e: Ujo usually keeps about 20 cormorants at home and put all of them into ukago (a basket to bring cormorants) a few hours before going out fishing.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Usho usually keeps about 20 cormorants at home and put all of them into ukago (a basket to bring cormorants) a few hours before going out fishing.
Usho usually keeps about 20 cormorants at home and put all of them into ukago (a basket to bring cormorants) a few hours before going out fishing.

sen.j: そして、その日の鵜の体調を見極め漁に連れて行く鵜決める。
sen.e: Then, he decides cormorants which he brings for fishing after judging their physical condition.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Then, he decides cormorants which he brings for fishing after judging their physical condition.
Then, he decides cormorants which he brings for fishing after judging their physical condition.

sen.j: 鵜への餌やりは1日1回でシーズン中は餌の量を少なくし、漁に行く前は常に空腹状態にさせている。
sen.e: Cormorants are fed once a day, and the volume of feed is reduced during the on-season so that they are kept hungry before going out fishing.
Cormorants are fed once a day, and the volume of feed is reduced during the on-season so that they are kept hungry before going out fishing.
Cormorants are fed once a day, and the volume of feed is reduced during the on-season so that they are kept hungry before going out fishing.

sen.j: 空腹状態でない鵜は鮎を捕らないため、漁に連れて行く鵜には漁が終わってから与える。
sen.e: As cormorants that are not hungry don't catch sweetfishes, those that are brought to fishing are fed only after fishing finished.
As cormorants that are not hungry don't catch sweetfishes, those that are brought to fishing are fed only after fishing finished.
As cormorants that are not hungry don't catch sweetfishes, those that are brought to fishing are fed only after fishing finished.

sen.j: 鵜飼では鵜を2羽で行動させる為、鵜飼以外の場所でも常に同じ組み合わせの2羽で行動させている。
sen.e: As ujo makes two cormorants act in pair in ukai, he usually makes same two cormorants act in pair in other places than that of ukai.
As usho makes two cormorants act in pair in ukai, he usually makes same two cormorants act in pair in other places than that of ukai.
As usho makes two cormorants act in pair in ukai, he usually makes same two cormorants act in pair in other places than that of ukai.

sen.j: これによりこの鵜同士の仲が良くなるが、他の鵜との仲はあまり良くない。
sen.e: As a result, these two cormorants get on well each other, but not with other cormorants.
As a result, these two cormorants get on well each other, but not with other cormorants.
As a result, these two cormorants get on well each other, but not with other cormorants.

sen.j: 尚、この組み合わせには雌雄の決まりはない。
sen.e: The above pair is not necessarily that of male and female.
The above pair is not necessarily that of male and female.
The above pair is not necessarily that of male and female.

sen.j: 昭和初期までは伊勢湾で海鵜を捕獲していたが、現在は茨城県日立市十王町で捕獲している。
sen.e: Although temminck's cormorants had been captured in Ise bay until the early Showa era, they are currently captured at Juo-machi, Hitachi City, Ibaragi Prefecture.
Although temminck's cormorants had been captured in Ise bay until the early Showa era, they are currently captured at Juo-machi, Hitachi City, Ibaragi Prefecture.
Although temminck's cormorants had been captured in Ise bay until the early Showa era, they are currently captured at Juo-machi, Hitachi City, Ibaragi Prefecture.

tit.e: Uayu (a sweetfish caught by a cormorant)
Uayu (a sweetfish caught by a cormorant)
Uayu (a sweetfish caught by a cormorant)

sen.j: 鵜が捕った鮎は「歯形の鮎」といわれ、鵜のくちばしの痕が付いている。
sen.e: A sweetfish caught by a cormorant, which is called "hagata no ayu" (literally, ayu with a tooth mark), has the mark of cormorant's beak.
A sweetfish caught by a cormorant, which is called 'hagata no ayu' (literally, ayu with a tooth mark), has the mark of cormorant's beak.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: A sweetfish caught by a cormorant, which is called 'hagata no ayu' (literally, ayu with a tooth mark), has the mark of cormorant's beak.

sen.j: くちばしで鮎を瞬殺するため新鮮で美味しいといわれている。
sen.e: It is said that uayu is fresh and tasty since it was instantly killed with a cormorant's beak.
It is said that uayu is fresh and tasty since it was instantly killed with a cormorant's beak.
It is said that uayu is fresh and tasty since it was instantly killed with a cormorant's beak.

sen.j: この鮎は通常市場では出回ることのない貴重で高価なものだが、観光旅館やホテルによっては鵜匠と契約し鵜鮎を賞味できる所もある。
sen.e: Uayu is so precious and expensive that it is normally not on sale at the market, but some tourist hotels serve it under the contract with ujou.
Uayu is so precious and expensive that it is normally not on sale at the market, but some tourist hotels serve it under the contract with usho.
Uayu is so precious and expensive that it is normally not on sale at the market, but some tourist hotels serve it under the contract with usho.

sen.j: 漁場は鵜飼を取り巻く環境により変わってきた。
sen.e: A fishing ground has changed according to the change of situation surrounding ukai.
A fishing ground has changed according to the change of situation surrounding ukai.
A fishing ground has changed according to the change of situation surrounding ukai.

sen.j: 明治42年当時の漁場は、美濃市州原から大垣市墨俣までだった。
sen.e: At the time of 1909. a fishing ground was the area from Suhara, Mino City to Sunomata, Ogaki City.
At the time of 1909, a fishing ground was the area from Suhara, Mino City to Sunomata, Ogaki City.
sen.cmt: ピリオドをコンマに訂正しました。
sen.e: At the time of 1909, a fishing ground was the area from Suhara, Mino City to Sunomata, Ogaki City.

sen.j: 戦後は、長良川中央漁業協同組合と長良川漁業協同組合の境界（長良川、今川、津保川合流点上流あたり）が長良と小瀬の境界となっている。
sen.e: After the war, the border between Nagaragawa Chuo Fisheries Cooperative Association and Nagaragawa Fisheries Cooperative Association (the upstream of the junction of Nagara river, Ima river and Ibo river) became the border of Nagara and Oze.

After the war, the border between Nagaragawa Chuo Fisheries Cooperative Association and Nagaragawa Fisheries Cooperative Association (the upstream of the junction of Nagara-gawa River, Ima-gawa River and Ibo-gawa River) became the border of Nagara and Oze.
sen.cmt: Nagara-gawa River, Ima-gawa River and Ibo-gawa River訂正しました。
sen.e: After the war, the border between Nagaragawa Chuo Fisheries Cooperative Association and Nagaragawa Fisheries Cooperative Association (the upstream of the junction of Nagara-gawa River, Ima-gawa River and Ibo-gawa River) became the border of Nagara and Oze.

sen.j: しかし、現在は観光鵜飼が主となるため実際の漁場は短くなってきている。
sen.e: As ukai is mainly conducted for tourist attraction purpose at present, its actual fishing ground has become shorter.
As ukai is mainly conducted for tourist attraction purpose at present, its actual fishing ground has become shorter.
As ukai is mainly conducted for tourist attraction purpose at present, its actual fishing ground has become shorter.

sen.j: 皇室御用の鵜飼。
sen.e: Ukai patronized by the Imperial Court
Ukai patronized by the Imperial Court
Ukai patronized by the Imperial Court

sen.j: 岐阜市ならびに関市の長良川における鵜飼は、日本で唯一宮内庁式部職鵜匠によって行われている（したがって身分は国家公務員である）。
sen.e: Ukai of Nagara-gawa river in Gifu City and Seki City are the only ukai in Japan that are conducted by shikibushoku ujo of Kunaicho (accordingly, they are national public servants).
Ukai of Nagara-gawa River in Gifu City and Seki City are the only ukai in Japan that are conducted by shikibushoku usho of Kunaicho (accordingly, they are national public servants).
sen.cmt: River大文字にしました。鵜匠→Ushoに訂正しました。
sen.e: Ukai of Nagara-gawa River in Gifu City and Seki City are the only ukai in Japan that are conducted by shikibushoku usho of Kunaicho (accordingly, they are national public servants).

sen.j: この鵜匠は岐阜市長良に6人、関市小瀬に3人おり、これらは全て代々世襲制である。
sen.e: There are six and three Shikibushoku ujo in Nagara, Gifu City and Oze, Seki City respectively, and all of them inherited the job based on the hereditary system.
There are six and three Shikibushoku usho in Nagara, Gifu City and Oze, Seki City respectively, and all of them inherited the job based on the hereditary system.
There are six and three Shikibushoku usho in Nagara, Gifu City and Oze, Seki City respectively, and all of them inherited the job based on the hereditary system.

sen.j: この鵜匠たちにより期間中に宮内庁の御料場で行われる8回の鵜飼を「御料鵜飼」という。
sen.e: Ukai that is conducted by these ujo eight times during the season at Kunaicho's goryoba is called "goryo ukai".
Ukai that is conducted by these usho eight times during the season at Kunaicho's goryoba is called 'goryo ukai.'
sen.cmt: 鵜匠→Ushoに訂正しました。原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。ピリオド位置を訂正しました。
sen.e: Ukai that is conducted by these usho eight times during the season at Kunaicho's goryoba is called 'goryo ukai.'

sen.j: 御料鵜飼で獲れた鮎は皇居へ献上されるのみならず、明治神宮や伊勢神宮へも奉納される。
sen.e: Sweetfishes that are caught in goryo ukai are offered not only to the Imperial Palace but also to Meiji-jingu Shrine and Ise-jingu Shrine.
Sweetfishes that are caught in goryo ukai are offered not only to the Imperial Palace but also to Meiji-jingu Shrine and Ise-jingu Shrine.
Sweetfishes that are caught in goryo ukai are offered not only to the Imperial Palace but also to Meiji-jingu Shrine and Ise-jingu Shrine.

sen.j: 全国的には鵜飼漁をする人は「鵜使い」と呼ばれるのだが、長良川鵜飼では世襲制のため古くから「鵜匠」と呼ばれている。
sen.e: While the people doing ukai fishing are generally called "Utukai", those doing ulkai in Nagara-gawa river are traditionally called "ujo" because of the hereditary system.
While the people doing ukai fishing are generally called 'Utukai,' those doing ulkai in Nagara-gawa River are traditionally called 'usho' because of the hereditary system.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。コンマ位置を訂正しました。River大文字にしました。鵜匠→Ushoに訂正しました。
sen.e: While the people doing ukai fishing are generally called 'Utukai,' those doing ulkai in Nagara-gawa River are traditionally called 'usho' because of the hereditary system.

sen.j: 御料鵜飼でのみ漁を許可している、一般に漁の出来ない禁漁区。
sen.e: Goryoba is basically a non-fishing area, and it is used only for goryo ukai.

sen.j: 郡上市嵩田（戦後廃止）
sen.e: Takeda, Gunjo City (abolished after the war)

sen.j: 長良橋の上流付近で行われる観光のための鵜飼。
sen.e: It is ukai for tourists that is conducted at the upstream of Nagarabashi Bridge.
It is ukai for tourists that is conducted at the upstream of Nagara-bashi Bridge.
sen.cmt: ハイフン補足しました。
sen.e: It is ukai for tourists that is conducted at the upstream of Nagara-bashi Bridge.

sen.j: 篝火を焚いた鵜舟がゆっくりと現れ、鵜が鮎を捕らえる様子を観覧船から眺める事が出来る。
sen.e: Ubune on which kagaribi is burning slowly appears and tourists can watch the scene where cormorants catch sweetfishes from a spectator boat.
Ubune on which kagaribi is burning slowly appears and tourists can watch the scene where cormorants catch sweetfishes from a spectator boat.
Ubune on which kagaribi is burning slowly appears and tourists can watch the scene where cormorants catch sweetfishes from a spectator boat.

sen.j: 御手洗船や花火や飲み物などを売る売店船もあり、岸に上がることなく鵜飼を楽しむ事ができる。
sen.e: Tourists can enjoy ukai without going ashore since a toilet boat and a shop boat, on which fireworks and drinks etc. are on sale, are also operated.
Tourists can enjoy ukai without going ashore since a toilet boat and a shop boat, on which fireworks and drinks etc. are on sale, are also operated.
Tourists can enjoy ukai without going ashore since a toilet boat and a shop boat, on which fireworks and drinks etc. are on sale, are also operated.

sen.j: 乗船前には乗船場にて鵜匠による鵜飼の説明が行われる。
sen.e: Before getting on board, explanations about ukai is done by ujo at the boarding place.
Before getting on board, explanations about ukai is done by usho at the boarding place.
Before getting on board, explanations about ukai is done by usho at the boarding place.

sen.j: 通常の鵜飼日は1回制鵜飼で、6隻の鵜舟が観覧舟の前を1往復する。
sen.e: Ukai is normally conducted once a day, and six ubune make one round trip in front of a spectator boat.
Ukai is normally conducted once a day, and six ubune make one round trip in front of a spectator boat.
Ukai is normally conducted once a day, and six ubune make one round trip in front of a spectator boat.

sen.j: 納涼鵜飼日は2回制鵜飼で総がらみも行われる。
sen.e: On the day of ukai in the cool of summer evening, ukai is conducted twice and sogarami is also conducted.
On the day of ukai in the cool of summer evening, ukai is conducted twice and sogarami is also conducted.
On the day of ukai in the cool of summer evening, ukai is conducted twice and sogarami is also conducted.

sen.j: 6隻の鵜舟が横隊になり、浅瀬に鮎を追い込んで巻き狩りする漁法。
sen.e: A fishing method in which six ubune line up in a row, drive sweetfishes into shallows and catch them.
A fishing method in which six ubune line up in a row, drive sweetfishes into shallows and catch them.

sen.j: 毎年5月11日は鵜飼開きである。
sen.e: Ukai-biraki festival is held on May 11 every year.
Ukai-biraki festival is held on May 11 every year.
Ukai-biraki festival is held on May 11 every year.

sen.j: シーズン中の鵜飼の安全と繁栄を祈願する神事である鵜飼安全祈願祭が行われた後、太鼓の演奏に見送られて次々と観覧船が川へと漕ぎ出して行く。
sen.e: After the ritual praying for the safety and prosperity of ukai during the season is held, spectator boats row out into the river one after another amid the performance of drums.
After the ritual praying for the safety and prosperity of ukai during the season is held, spectator boats row out into the river one after another amid the performance of drums.
After the ritual praying for the safety and prosperity of ukai during the season is held, spectator boats row out into the river one after another amid the performance of drums.

sen.j: 市民参加の各種イベントが行われ、芸妓による踊り船の運航や花火の打ち上げなどが行われる。
sen.e: Various events are held by citizens including the operation of odoribune (dancing boat) by geigi (geisha) and the sending up of fireworks.
Various events are held by citizens including the operation of odoribune (dancing boat) by geigi (geisha) and the sending up of fireworks.
Various events are held by citizens including the operation of odoribune (dancing boat) by geigi (geisha) and the sending up of fireworks.

sen.j: 「うーたん」
sen.e: "Utan"
Utan'
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。
sen.e: Utan'

sen.j: 岐阜市が長良川鵜飼を全国にアピールするため募集したデザインの中から選ばれた鵜をデザインしたキャラクター。
sen.e: "Utan" is a mascot modeled on a cormorant which Gifu City selected in order to promote Ngaragawa-ukai across the nation.
Utan' is a mascot modeled on a cormorant which Gifu City selected in order to promote Ngara-gawa ukai across the nation.
sen.cmt: 前出の表記に合せて訂正しました。
sen.e: Utan' is a mascot modeled on a cormorant which Gifu City selected in order to promote Ngara-gawa ukai across the nation.

sen.j: 通常は鵜匠の衣装を着ているが、場合によってPR対象の関連衣装を着る。
sen.e: It usually wears the clothes of ujo, but it sometimes wear other clothes for PR purpose.
It usually wears the clothes of usho, but it sometimes wear other clothes for PR purpose.
It usually wears the clothes of usho, but it sometimes wear other clothes for PR purpose.

sen.j: 名称は、鵜の「う」と「ちゃん」の幼児語をもじって「うーたん」となっている。
sen.e: Its name "Utan" consists of "u", a Japanese word corresponding to a cormorant, and "tan", a child's word of "chan".
Its name 'Utan' consists of 'u,' a Japanese word corresponding to a cormorant, and 'tan,' a child's word of 'chan.'
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。コンマ、ピリオド位置を訂正しました。
sen.e: Its name 'Utan' consists of 'u,' a Japanese word corresponding to a cormorant, and 'tan,' a child's word of 'chan.'

tit.cmt: 前出の表記に合せて訂正しました。

sen.j: 鵜飼いの魅力を広めるため岐阜にゆかりのある著名人に委任。
sen.e: Famous people who are associated with Gifu are designated as the ambassador of Nagara-gawa ukai.
Famous people who are associated with Gifu are designated as the ambassador of Nagara-gawa ukai.
Famous people who are associated with Gifu are designated as the ambassador of Nagara-gawa ukai.

sen.e: This sysem was established in 1999.

sen.j: 所在地：〒500-8009 岐阜市湊町1-2（長良橋南橋詰にある鵜飼観覧船のりばの横）

sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。

sen.j: 長良川鵜飼は1300年ほど前から行われており、その歴史は日本で行われている鵜飼の歴史と重複する。
sen.e: Nagara-gawa ukai has been conducted for about 1,300 years and its history overlaps the history of Japanese ukai.
Nagara-gawa ukai has been conducted for about 1,300 years and its history overlaps the history of Japanese ukai.
Nagara-gawa ukai has been conducted for about 1,300 years and its history overlaps the history of Japanese ukai.

sen.j: 鵜飼は権力者の贅沢のひとつだったため、その時々の権力者に守られ今日に至っている。
sen.e: As ukai was a luxurious hobby of persons of power, it has been protected persons of power of the time.
As ukai was a luxurious hobby of persons of power, it has been protected persons of power of the time.
As ukai was a luxurious hobby of persons of power, it has been protected persons of power of the time.

sen.j: 江戸時代においては徳川幕府および尾張徳川家の保護のもとに行われていた。
sen.e: During the Edo period, it was conducted under the protection of Tokugawa bakufu and Owari Tokugawa family.
During the Edo period, it was conducted under the protection of Tokugawa bakufu and Owari Tokugawa family.
During the Edo period, it was conducted under the protection of Tokugawa bakufu and Owari Tokugawa family.

sen.j: 明治維新後は一時有栖川宮家御用となった。
sen.e: After the Meiji Restoration, it was once patronized by the house of Imperial Prince Arisugawa.
After the Meiji Restoration, it was once patronized by the house of Imperial Prince Arisugawa.
After the Meiji Restoration, it was once patronized by the house of Imperial Prince Arisugawa.

sen.j: その後、明治23年に宮内省主猟寮属となり、宮内省（現宮内庁）の直轄となった。
sen.e: Thereafter, it was affiliated to the Shuryoryo (division of hunting) of the Imperial Household Ministry (current Imperial Household Agency) in 1890.
Thereafter, it was affiliated to the Shuryoryo (division of hunting) of the Imperial Household Ministry (current Imperial Household Agency) in 1890.
Thereafter, it was affiliated to the Shuryoryo (division of hunting) of the Imperial Household Ministry (current Imperial Household Agency) in 1890.

sen.j: 長良川の鵜匠は職名「宮内庁式部職鵜匠」である。
sen.e: The job title of ujo of Nagaragawa is "Kunaicho shikibushoku ujo".
The job title of usho of Nagara-gawa River is 'Kunaicho shikibushoku usho.'
sen.cmt: 鵜匠→Ushoに訂正しました。原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。Nagara-gawa Riverに訂正しました。ピリオド位置を訂正しました。
sen.e: The job title of usho of Nagara-gawa River is 'Kunaicho shikibushoku usho.'

sen.j: 松尾芭蕉が「おもしろうて やがてかなしき 鵜舟かな」という一句を残している。
sen.e: Basho MATSUO composed a haiku, "Omoshirote yagatekanashiki ubunekana" ("I was interested in ubune, but gradually became sad").
Basho MATSUO composed a haiku, 'Omoshirote yagatekanashiki ubunekana' (I was interested in ubune, but gradually became sad).
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。括弧内の" "は削除しました。
sen.e: Basho MATSUO composed a haiku, 'Omoshirote yagatekanashiki ubunekana' (I was interested in ubune, but gradually became sad).

sen.j: 平安時代中期に作られた辞書「和名抄」に、美濃国方県郡の鵜飼について記述。
sen.e: A description concerning the ukai of Katagata district of Mino Province is seen In "Wamyosho", a dictionary compiled in the middle of Heian period.
A description concerning the ukai of Katagata County of Mino Province is seen in 'Wamyosho,' a dictionary compiled in the middle of Heian period.
sen.cmt: Countyに訂正しました。in小文字にしました。原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。コンマの位置を訂正しました。
sen.e: A description concerning the ukai of Katagata County of Mino Province is seen in 'Wamyosho,' a dictionary compiled in the middle of Heian period.

sen.j: 「集解釈別記」に、鵜飼37戸との記録。
sen.e: It was recorded in "Shukaishakubekki" that 37 houses were engaged in ukai.
It was recorded in 'Shukaishakubekki' that 37 houses were engaged in ukai.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。
sen.e: It was recorded in 'Shukaishakubekki' that 37 houses were engaged in ukai.

sen.j: 「新撰美濃誌」に、方県郡鵜飼の郷9箇村の記録。
sen.e: It was recorded in "Shinsenminoshi" that ukai was conducted at nine villages in Katagata district.
It was recorded in 'Shinsenminoshi' that ukai was conducted at nine villages in Katagata County.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。Countyに訂正しました。
sen.e: It was recorded in 'Shinsenminoshi' that ukai was conducted at nine villages in Katagata County.

sen.j: 文明 (日本)年間に、一条兼良が美濃の正保寺に滞在し鵜飼を見物した記録。
sen.e: There exists a record saying Kaneyoshi ICHIJO stayed at Shoho-ji Temple in Mino and saw ukai in the era of Bunmei (Japan).
There exists a record saying Kaneyoshi ICHIJO stayed at Shoho-ji Temple in Mino and saw ukai in the era of Bunmei (Japan).
There exists a record saying Kaneyoshi ICHIJO stayed at Shoho-ji Temple in Mino and saw ukai in the era of Bunmei (Japan).

sen.j: 延喜年間に、長良川河畔に鵜飼7戸の記録があり、藤原利仁は、その7戸の鵜飼に鮎を献上させ、天皇の気に入り方県郡七郷の地を鵜飼に要する篝松の料としてたまわり、鵜飼七郷と呼んだ。
sen.e: There exists a record saying that seven houses along Nagara-gawa river were engaged in ukai during the era of Engi, that FUJIWARA no Toshihito made these seven houses offer sweetfishes to the Emperor, that the emperor was pleased and gave Shichigo Village in Katagata County as the place for planting pine trees for kagaribi, and that this village came to be called Ukaishihigo.

There exists a record saying that seven houses along Nagara-gawa River were engaged in ukai during the era of Engi, that FUJIWARA no Toshihito made these seven houses offer sweetfishes to the Emperor, that the Emperor was pleased and gave Shichigo Village in Katagata County as the place for planting pine trees for kagaribi, and that this village came to be called Ukaishihigo.
sen.cmt: River大文字にしました。Emperor大文字にしました。
sen.e: There exists a record saying that seven houses along Nagara-gawa River were engaged in ukai during the era of Engi, that FUJIWARA no Toshihito made these seven houses offer sweetfishes to the Emperor, that the Emperor was pleased and gave Shichigo Village in Katagata County as the place for planting pine trees for kagaribi, and that this village came to be called Ukaishihigo.

sen.j: 平治の乱で源頼朝が源義朝と敗走する時はぐれ、長良川河畔をさまよった末に鵜飼の長である白明の家にて宿泊。
sen.e: After having been defeated in Heiji Disturbance, Minamoto no Yoritomo, along with Minamoto no Yoshitomo, wandered along the Nagaragawa river and stayed at the home of Hakumyo, the head of ukai fisheremen.

After having been defeated in Heiji Disturbance, MINAMOTO no Yoritomo, along with MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo, wandered along the Nagara-gawa River and stayed at the home of Hakumyo, the head of ukai fishermen.
sen.cmt: fishermenスペル訂正しました。MINAMOTO大文字にしました。Nagara-gawa Riverに訂正しました。
sen.e: After having been defeated in Heiji Disturbance, MINAMOTO no Yoritomo, along with MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo, wandered along the Nagara-gawa River and stayed at the home of Hakumyo, the head of ukai fishermen.

sen.j: そこで鮎鮨等にて持て成しを受けた。
sen.e: At that time, he was entertained with ayuzusi (fermented sushi with sweetfish) etc.
At that time, he was entertained with ayuzusi (fermented sushi with sweetfish) etc.
At that time, he was entertained with ayuzusi (fermented sushi with sweetfish) etc.

sen.j: その後、建久3年右大将として上洛する際に、白明の子を呼び出して恩に報い、また毎年鮎鮨を鎌倉に送るよう命じた。
sen.e: When he went to Kyoto in 1192 as Udaisho (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), he called Hakumyo, expressed his gratitude and ordered to send ayzushi to Kamakura every year.

When he went to Kyoto in 1192 as Udaisho (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), he called a child of Hakumyo, expressed his gratitude and ordered to send ayzushi to Kamakura every year.
sen.cmt: a child of 補足しました。
sen.e: When he went to Kyoto in 1192 as Udaisho (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), he called a child of Hakumyo, expressed his gratitude and ordered to send ayzushi to Kamakura every year.

sen.j: 永禄7年、織田信長は長良川の鵜飼を見物し、鵜飼それぞれに鵜匠の名称を授け鷹匠と同様に遇し、1戸に禄米10俵を給与した。
sen.e: In 1564, Nobunaga ODA saw Nagara-gawa ukai and gave the title of ujo as well as ten bales (traditional unit for rice, which is 60 kilograms) of stipend to each ukai fishermen, which was the same treatment with takajo (a hawker).

In 1564, Nobunaga ODA saw Nagara-gawa ukai and gave the title of usho as well as ten bales (traditional unit for rice, which is 60 kilograms) of stipend to each ukai fishermen, which was the same treatment with takajo (a hawker).

In 1564, Nobunaga ODA saw Nagara-gawa ukai and gave the title of usho as well as ten bales (traditional unit for rice, which is 60 kilograms) of stipend to each ukai fishermen, which was the same treatment with takajo (a hawker).

sen.j: 元和 (日本)元年、徳川家康が鵜飼を見物し、石焼きの鮎に感賞した。
sen.e: In 1615, Ieyasu TOKUGAWA saw ukai and relished ayu baked in hot pebbles.
In 1615, Ieyasu TOKUGAWA saw ukai and relished ayu baked in hot pebbles.
In 1615, Ieyasu TOKUGAWA saw ukai and relished ayu baked in hot pebbles.

sen.j: 以来、江戸城に毎年鮎を献上するのが慣例となり、鵜匠21戸に各10両の扶持を給与した。
sen.e: Since then, it became a practice to offer ayu to Edo-jo castle every year, and each of 21 ujo was entitled a stipend of ten ryo.
Since then, it became a practice to offer ayu to Edo-jo Castle every year, and each of 21 usho was entitled a stipend of ten ryo.
sen.cmt: Castle大文字にしました。鵜匠→Ushoに訂正しました。
sen.e: Since then, it became a practice to offer ayu to Edo-jo Castle every year, and each of 21 usho was entitled a stipend of ten ryo.

sen.j: その後、鵜飼は衰退し文化 (元号)2年には12戸となる。
sen.e: Ukai declined thereafter and the number of houses engaged in ukai became 12 in 1805.
Ukai declined thereafter and the number of houses engaged in ukai became 12 in 1805.
Ukai declined thereafter and the number of houses engaged in ukai became 12 in 1805.

sen.j: その12戸に毎年120石、532両2分を給与すると再び回復した。
sen.e: The above number began to increase again when a stipend of each house was increased to 120 koku per year and 532 ryo 2 bu.
The above number began to increase again when a stipend of each house was increased to 120 koku per year and 532 ryo 2 bu.
The above number began to increase again when a stipend of each house was increased to 120 koku per year and 532 ryo 2 bu.

sen.j: 明治維新で一時衰退したが、明治天皇の代にはしばしば沙汰があり大膳職に上納された。
sen.e: Ukai once declined due to the Meiji restoration, but sweetfishes were often offered to Daizenshiki (Office of the Palace Table) during the era of Emperor Meiji.
Ukai once declined due to the Meiji Restoration, but sweetfishes were often offered to Daizenshiki (Office of the Palace Table) during the era of Emperor Meiji.
sen.cmt: Meiji Restoration大文字にしました。
sen.e: Ukai once declined due to the Meiji Restoration, but sweetfishes were often offered to Daizenshiki (Office of the Palace Table) during the era of Emperor Meiji.

sen.j: 1890年から稲葉郡長良村古津その他武儀郡、郡上郡の各村で延長1471間を宮内省の鮎漁の御猟場に編入された。
sen.e: In 1890, a total of 1471 ken (about 2.67 km) of Nagara-gawa river, located in Furutsu, Nagara-mura, Inaba-gun, Mugi-gun and Gunjo-gun, was incorporated into the goryoba of Imperial Household Ministry.
In 1890, a total of about 2.67 km of Nagara-gawa River, located in Furutsu, Nagara-mura, Inaba-gun, Mugi-gun and Gunjo-gun, was incorporated into the goryoba of Imperial Household Ministry.
sen.cmt: 尺貫法をメートル法のみの表記にしました。River大文字にしました。
sen.e: In 1890, a total of about 2.67 km of Nagara-gawa River, located in Furutsu, Nagara-mura, Inaba-gun, Mugi-gun and Gunjo-gun, was incorporated into the goryoba of Imperial Household Ministry.

sen.j: 1918年に英国皇太子（ジョージ5世 (イギリス王)）を迎え天覧鵜飼が行われた。
sen.e: In 1918, the Emperor watched ukai together with the Prince of Wales (George Ⅴ (king of the U.K.)).
In 1918, the Emperor watched ukai together with the Prince of Wales (George V [king of the U.K.]).
sen.cmt: 全角を半角にしました。括弧内括弧を［］に訂正しました。
sen.e: In 1918, the Emperor watched ukai together with the Prince of Wales (George V [king of the U.K.]).

sen.j: 1936年と1961年の2度、チャーリー・チャップリンが鵜飼見物のために来岐。
sen.e: Charles Chaplin visited Gifu twice, in 1936 and in 1961, to watch ukai.
Charles CHAPLIN visited Gifu twice, in 1936 and in 1961, to watch ukai.
Charles CHAPLIN visited Gifu twice, in 1936 and in 1961, to watch ukai.

sen.j: 鵜匠をアーティストと賞賛し「ワンダフル」を連発したと言われている。
sen.e: It is said that he hailed ujo as artists and kept on saying "wonderful".
It is said that he hailed usho as artists and kept on saying 'wonderful.'
sen.cmt: 鵜匠→Ushoに訂正しました。原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。ピリオド位置を訂正しました。
sen.e: It is said that he hailed usho as artists and kept on saying 'wonderful.'

sen.j: 1962年に昭和天皇を迎え、天覧鵜飼が行われた。
sen.e: In 1962, ukai was held in the pesence of the Emperor Showa.
In 1962, ukai was held in the presence of the Emperor Showa.
In 1962, ukai was held in the presence of the Emperor Showa.

sen.j: 1997年に今上天皇皇后を迎え、天覧鵜飼が行われた。
sen.e: In 1997, ukai was held in the pesence of the present Emperor and Empress.
In 1997, ukai was held in the presence of the present Emperor and Empress.
In 1997, ukai was held in the presence of the present Emperor and Empress.
